Topic.Title: Obam's Justice Dept. Says No Crime, No foul

Message.Msg: For all the bluster of Obama, pre- and post-2008, as well as that of Attorney General Eric Holder concerning the alleged criminal activities on Wall Street, there have been zero Wall Street prosecutions under Obama/Holder. Compare that with his predecessors Bush and Clinton: Bush: 1,300 convictions; Clinton: 1,000 convictions; Obama: Zero attempts. And why the difference in prosecuting the law? The GAI report reveals that the Department of Justice upper echelon is stacked with attorneys, including Eric Holder, from law firms representing the very same companies involved in the financial meltdown of 2008, as well as financial corporations with questionable actions during the Obama administration. ... AIG, Goldman Sachs, Wells Fargo, J.P. Morgan Chase, Bank of America, CitiBank, Deutsche Bank, ING, Morgan Stanley, UBS, Wilmington Trust, and John Corzine's MF Global. Read more:http://times247.com/articles/on-wall-street-obama-all-bluster#ixzz24E7Ho7Hq

Topic.Title: Corn Prices up 23% world wide in July

Message.Msg: "The refreshing thing about Romney, he says that every program will be looked at closely." Unfortunately that is the same promise made by Lord Barry. No politician will ask for, wish for, allow a review of thier actions and have anyone be able to ask why. More stupidity on the part of government; The Labor Department paid out hundreds of thousands of dollars in federal stimulus funds to a public relations firm to run more than 100 commercials touting the Obama administration’s “green training” job efforts on two popular MSNBC cable shows, records show. The commercials ran on MSNBC on shows hosted by Rachel Maddow and Keith Olbermann in 2009, but the contract didn’t report any jobs created, according to records recently reviewed by The Washington Times. Spending reports under the federal Recovery Act show $495,000 paid to McNeely Pigott & Fox Public Relations LLC, which the Labor Department hired to raise awareness “among employers and influencers about the [Job Corps] program’s existing and new training initiatives in high growth and environmentally friendly career areas” as well as spreading the word to prospective Job Corps enrollees. “Hiring a PR firm does not create jobs and this was obviously meant for selling a particular political agenda,” Mr. Williams said. “The placement really reeks of a political ad rather than a job ad, and taxpayers see through this." Read more: Labor Department spends stimulus funds for ads during Olbermann, Maddow shows - Washington Times. http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2012/aug/21/stimulus-funds-spent-obama-ads-olbermann-maddow/#ixzz24DyVCRBl

Topic.Title: Corn Prices up 23% world wide in July

Message.Msg: I believe that our climate is changing. I am sure that human habitation has had some impact on those changes. I think Mother Nature is also up to her old tricks as she has been for billions of years. We should make determined efforts to reduce the human caused pollution as much as reasonably possible. But that effort has to be a concerted effort all inhabitants of this big rock, not just the U.S. and we certainly are not required to pay for it all. China, Africa, the Middle East, Russia, etc. all must contribute. There are some things that 'just happen' as nature takes its course. We can't and shouldn't attempt to correct nature. We are not smart enough to know all the things we cause versus the things nature causes in the course of time. We certainly should not presume we have the intelligence to change nature, at least not in a positive vain.
